column2: MARYLAND DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
2. This road sign means:
3. When driving in fog, drivers should use:
4. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
5. Parking is not allowed:
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column8: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.

column2: 6. Just like alcohol and other drugs, drowsiness can:
column6: help you to be a better driver.

column2: 7. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
8. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 9. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
10. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 11. Don't be afraid to sound a sharp blast on your horn when:
column4: another vehicle is in danger of hitting you.
column6: when a child is about to run into the street.

column2: 12. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column6: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 13. Distracted driving is anything that:
column4: causes you to focus on your driving.
column8: takes your attention away from driving.

column2: 14. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column6: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column8: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.

column2: 15. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column6: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 16. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
17. This road sign means:
18. This road sign means:
19. This is:
20. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.
column6: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column8: watch for children and be ready to stop.

column2: 21. When you are facing a green light and there are pedestrians in the intersection:
column4: you have the right-of-way over pedestrians.
column6: you must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians.
column8: you must signal your intention to cross the intersection at least 100 feet before yielding the right-of-way.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
24. Green and white signs:
column4: give information about directions and distances.
column6: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.

column2: 25. When passing another vehicle, you should:
column4: check your mirrors and blind spots.
column6: drive at the same speed as the vehicle you are passing.
column8: assume the other vehicle will maintain a constant speed.
